text: let me start off by saying that I love

Malawi this is a good country will come
to Kigali
Comoros this massive continent of 54
countries offer sights smells and
experiences that are unparalleled to
anywhere on earth this is a fact but I
want to address an important issue about
social profile name that also applies to
being black in the US Asian in Europe or
Hispanic in Australia
it's a form of racism and anyone who
physically stands out in a place will
experience it okay we just got pulled
over by the police and they wanted my
passport how much money did you give him
so we give him 10,000 in 2018 I have
visited 21 countries in sub-saharan
Africa the ones you see here in orange
regardless of which country I explore
whenever I leave my hotel room all eyes
are on me I have this sixth sense of
being extra observant and I always
notice people's heads turning at me on
the streets this attention can get
overwhelming and uncomfortable
especially if you travel solo or carry
around a camera like I do and while most
people are simply curious I need to be
very careful of scams and bribes because
I am perceived as a walking ATM machine
who has money to give to everyone what
do I mean by this at the airport in
Lemont Togo the security officer
examined my computer for 20 minutes and
wouldn't give it back until I offered
him money in Tanzania I was walking
through a market when I was sworn by
about five vendors reaching into my
pockets for money in Chad I needed to
call my friend but my phone died so I
asked a guy to use his phone for two
seconds and he insisted that I pay him
in Uganda I was road tripping when a cop
pulled us over and questioned me for 20
minutes until I offered him a payment in
Angola when I paid for my evz at the
airport they ripped me off 20 bucks and
wouldn't give me change these are just a
few of the hundreds of situations I've
come across in Africa where I am
discriminated on or asked for money
simply because of my skin color this is
especially true in taxis or any touristy
area right now
I am their biggest target none of my
black American friends would ever
experience this in Africa like I have
but through all of this I've learned
that I need to be firm in my
decision-making I must walk with
Authority like I always have a plan and
don't let anyone talk me into doing
something if my gut tells me it's not
safe even though all human beings have
the same blood it pains my heart that
this is the sad reality of today I'm not
making this video to scare you away from
Africa as I've told you in the intro
it's an amazing place with so much to
offer I'm just giving you a glimpse of
the life that exists here as an outsider
I wish the world wasn't this way but it
is and you need to be aware of it when
you travel I'm drew pinsky and if you
like my travel videos please click
Subscribe and join me as I plan to visit
every country in the world it's electric
